cause.description:
People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) is dedicated to establishing and protecting the rights of all animals. PETA operates under the simple principle that animals are not ours to eat, wear, experiment on, or use for entertainment.
To learn more about PETA, go to: http://www.peta.org/
peta2 is a branch of PETA designed especially for younger (High School/College aged) people. To visit them go to http://www.peta2.com
We encourage you to try vegetarianism/veganism. If you need help, please visit: http://features.peta.org/VegetarianStarterKit/index.asp
Have a question about Animal Rights as a philosophy or practice? Try this website: http://www.animal-rights.com
Remember: You can help animals everywhere by joining PETA's Action Team today: http://bit.ly/action-team.
1. Animals are not ours to eat.
2. Animals are not ours to wear.
3. Animals are not ours for entertainment.
4. Animals are not ours to experiment on.
cause.mission: End the exploitation of all animals.
cause.name: PETA: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals
